result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd D. Deneen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions and details: 

Probation in this case shall be concurrent with probation in 16CF134 but consecutive to any sentence the Defendant is already serving. 

Defendant to pay $1200 restitution, jointly/severally with co-Defendant J Kovars. 

Obey rules and regulations of probation. 

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the department. 

Court waives costs. 

Credit in the event of revocation: 1 day.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Status in 16CF41, 16CF134, and 17CF42. Defendant Todd D. Deneen in court, in custody, with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty. L informs the Court of the parties' agreement for resolution whereby 17CF42 will be DRI in its entirety, counts 2 and 3 of 16CF41 will be DRI, and def will plead no contest to count 1/substantial battery in 16CF41 and also to count 1/bail jumping in 16CF134. Agreement calls for 4 years probation, concurrent between 16CF41 and 16CF134 but consecutive to sentence def is now serving. Additionally, def to pay restitution joint/several with J Kovars.

Def pleads no contest to count 1 of 16CF41 and count 1 of 16CF134. Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence: 
16CF41 - withheld for 4 years probation, consecutive to any sentence def is already serving but concurrent with sentence pronounced today in 16CF134. 
16CF134 - withheld for 4 years probation, concurrent with the term in 16CF41 but consecutive to any sentence def is already serving including ES; in both probation matters, def to pay restitution $1200 joint and several with co-defendant J Kovars; obey rules/regs; attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the department; costs waived in both cases

Other charges in these two cases and entire 17CF42 DRI.

Credit: 1 day, to be applied, in 16CF41.
to Produce/Transport

16CF41, 16CF134, and 17CF42/status. Defendant Todd D. Deneen not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant Todd D. Deneen. Def is in custody at Prairie du Chien Correctional. Atty. L asks for trial scheduling. DA plans to move for consolidation of the bail jumping matter(s) but notes State prefers to try the substantial battery at this point (count 1 of 16CF41). DA esimates 6-7 witnesses. Atty. L plans for fewer witnesses; estimates 3 day trial will be long enough. In 16CF41, Court sets JT for 2/26-2/28, FPT 2/23 at 2, and final status 2/7 at 1:30. 16CF134 and 17CF42 will be set for status 2/7 at 1:30 with one or both of those matters possibly to be consolidated into 16CF41.  Jury trial scheduled for February 26, 2018 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 23, 2018 at 02:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
